label: Bill of Sale for ten slaves to Thomas Wilson of Colleton District, South Carolina, October 5, 1807
description: A bill of sale to Thomas Wilson for the purchase of ten slaves from John Potter, in payment of debts owed. The sale was issued by the Sheriff's Office in Colleton District, Charleston, South Carolina.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: A bill of sale to Thomas Wilson for the purchase of ten slaves from John Potter, in payment of debts owed. The sale was issued by the Sheriff's Office in Colleton District, Charleston, South Carolina.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information and reuse requirements contact Special Collections at Addlestone Library, College of Charleston, Charleston, SC, 29424.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 600 dpi, 24-bit depth, color, Epson Expression 10000XL, Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
Charleston: Printed by W.P. YOUNG

State of South Carolina] SHERIFF's OFFICE.
COLLETON DISTRICT.

John Potter] [Illegible] Fi: Fa: in debt
To 
Thos Wilson

Smith and Bacot
Attornies.

KNOW all Men by these presents that by virtue of the above writ of fieri facias
to me directed, as Sheriff of Colleton district, in the state aforesaid, and regularly
lodged in my office, the property of Thomas Wilson Esquire
was levied on, and taken under execution;
afterwards the property so levied on, was legally advertised for sale in the month
of September and on the fifth day of October, in the
year of our Lord, one thousand eight hundred
and seven being the first Monday in said month,
between the hours of eleven in the forenoon, and three in the afternoon, on said day

ten negro slaves, Virg: Betsy, Philis, Nancy
Chloe and six children Virg: Mary, Rose, Beck,
Simon, Nancy, and Will

Sold on account of the above execution,being the property so levied on, was
disposed of at public auction, to Thomas Drayton Esquire
for the sum of One thousand five hundred and
forty five dollars- he, at that price or sum, being the highest and last
KNOWN That I have received from the said Thomas Drayton Esq.
the aforesaid sum of One thousand five hundred 
and forty five dollars-

and in pursuance thereof, I have delivered to him the said ten negro slaves, 
Virg: Betsy, Philis, Nancy, Chloe and six children 
namely, Mary, Rose, Beck, Simon, Nancy, 
and Will
according to the usage and custom in such cases, in the state aforesaid.

IN TESTIMONY WHEREOF, I have hereunto set my Hand and Seal, the Day
and Year before written.

Sealed, Signed and Delivered
in the Presence of
John Fabian

M. Youngblood
Shff. Col. Dist. [Sheriff Colleton District]
